Pre-Game Insights: The Houston Astros (71-62) welcome the Kansas City Royals (75-59) at Minute Maid Park on Friday. The pitchers who are expected to start are Seth Lugo and Framber Valdez.

Kansas City has a slugging % of .425 and have been called out on strikes 911 times, while being walked on 350 occasions. They have accrued 636 runs batted in as well as 1,165 hits on the year, and their average at the plate sits at .258. The Royals have compiled 235 doubles as a team and have knocked 153 baseballs out of the park. They have racked up 654 runs scored and hold an on-base percentage of .314. As a unit, the Kansas City Royals are putting up 4.9 runs per game, which puts them at 6th in baseball.

The Houston Astros have a team on-base percentage of .321 and a team batting average of .261 on the season. They have struck out on 964 occasions (28th in the league) and have earned 1,192 hits. Houston is sitting with 160 home runs so far this year as well as 580 runs batted in. The Astros hold a slugging % of .419 and they have an average of 4.56 runs per game (12th in MLB).
